string.value: #p2111000# asked me to search Dr. De Lang's house, and if I find any information inside, I have to report it to him. I better head off to the missing alchemist's house.

There were some writings found at the missing alchemist's house, but nothing seems significant. It did mention a pendant multiple times, though... a pendant? What does that have to do with his studies?

What I want you to do now is to search the house of the alchemist that has gone missing. It's the very place where the accident occurred. We've already searched the house a number of times, but I'm sure there's still a lot that hasn't been found, especially #bDe Lang's Secret Note#k...

That's why I want you to go there and find even the smallest piece of evidence. It'd be fantastic if you can find the Secret Note, but even if you can't, a nondescript sentence will be better than nothing.
I do believe that someone like you, who never knew about the missing alchemist, can provide a fresh eye to this investigation and find something we may have missed...
If you are not interested, then that's okay. Just don't ever mention the incident ever again.

How was the search? Did you find anything particularly interesting? Any clues? 
#b#L0#I wasn't able to find anything.#l 
#b#L1#(What did it Say again...)#l 
#b#L2#I saw a formula to making a mechanical glove.#l 
#b#L3#It really wasn't much... just a story about a pendant...#l
...really? A pendant... a pendant... maybe that's...\r\n#b#L0#What do you mean by that? Is there a special meaning to the word Pendant that was written on the wall?#l
No! It's nothing. We better find out more information about the missing alchemist. Thank you for your help. Now, if you'll excuse me...
Hmm... How was it? I thought a fresh eye like you who doesn't know anything about the missing alchemist would find something new...
A formula for the mechanical glove? The missing alchemist was an Alcadno, so of course he should have something like that.
Why aren't you saying something? Did you forget the clue already?
